result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:49 AM Defendant Arthur D Seaberry in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Arthur D Seaberry.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense was waiting for specific discovery from the State Crime Lab and has not received it yet.
Defense has filed an amended discovery demand with an updated list of what is needed.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Amended Motion and Demand for Specific Discovery - State Crime Lab, filed by Atty. Griffis

9:52 AM Defendant Arthur D Seaberry in court.  Attorney Justin G Griffis in court for Arthur D Seaberry.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests more time to complete the investigation.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:06 AM Defendant Arthur D Seaberry in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has received discovery and an offer.
Defense requests time to review.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:45 AM Defendant Arthur D Seaberry in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective David VanElls, of the City of Waueksha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Griffis.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

10:17 AM Defendant Arthur D Seaberry in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
